Installing the Cellulose Fibre via the roof to a depth of 100mm providing you with a minimum R2.5/R3 rating, giving you an insulation solution above recommended levels. Our installers are trained for all situations and pride themselves on doing a quality job on all different roofs types and handle them with care and expertise including: Tile, Tin, Clip Lock and Decrotile. Cellulose fibre can also be installed at varying depths enabling it to provide a wide range of R-values across a wider scope of applications that any other insulation product on the market.

Warm in Winter and Cool In Summer

Thickness for thickness, Cellulose Fibre insulation keeps your home warm in winter and cool in summer offering up to 8 degrees difference. This is because Cellulose Fibre is based on paper which is a natural insulation material, and it forms a complete blanket over the roof leaving no gaps, unlike other types of insulation materials. To be technical, Cellulose Fibre has an impressive thermal conductivity value of only 0.036 w/mk. The loose fill installation method ensures a complete seal, eliminating gaps, cracks and other cold bridges. All from recycled newspaper!

Fire Safety People are often concerned that Cellulose Fibre, being made from newspaper, might not be safe because of the risk of fire. In fact Cellulose Fibre is extremely resistant to fire, as illustrated.
